intro: Bartsia orthocarpiflora subsp. villosa, commonly known as the hairy bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its subspecies villosa is distinguished by its hairy leaves and stems, which provide a distinctive appearance.
